content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::String)
    questions = Regex(r"^# Question\n((?:\s|\S)*)")
    answers = Regex(r"^# Answer\n((?:\s|\S)*)")

    question_matches = match.(questions, md)
    answer_matches = match.(answers, md)

    questions_text = map(q -> strip(String(q[1])), question_matches)
    answers_text = map(a -> strip(String(a[1])), answer_matches)

    return zip(questions_text, answers_text)
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all sections in the markdown text that start with `# Question` and `# Answer`. It then strips any leading whitespace and newlines from the matched texts using the `strip` function. Finally, it returns a tuple of the question and answer pairs.
